summary: The concept of "business-to-government" (B2G) refers to the interactions and transactions between businesses and government entities within the European Union. This relationship is crucial for regulatory compliance, public procurement, and the provision of services. B2G frameworks facilitate the exchange of information, enabling businesses to navigate complex legal requirements and engage in public contracts effectively. The EU promotes transparency and efficiency in B2G interactions through various directives and regulations, ensuring that businesses can contribute to public policy and governance while adhering to legal standards. This concept underscores the importance of collaboration between the private sector and governmental bodies in achieving common objectives.
